revisions.rev:
The following is a '''list of [[spreadsheet]]s'''. ==OpenSource and Free Software== ===Cloud and On-line Spreadsheets=== {{main|List of online spreadsheets}} * [[EditGrid]] - Free for both{{cite web|url=http://www.editgrid.com/site/support/faq#A9|title=FAQ|work=EditGrid website|publisher=Team and Concepts Limited|accessdate=27 February 2011}} personal and commercial use. * [[Expresso spreadsheet]] - Free edition. * [[Google_docs|Google Docs]] - Free.[http://www.google.com/google-d-s/spreadsheets/ Google Docs] * [[Office Web Apps]] - Free. * [[Sheetster]] * [[Simple Spreadsheet]] - Free and open source. * [[Smartsheet]] - Free trial. * [[Tiki Wiki CMS Groupware]] includes [http://doc.tiki.org/Spreadsheet a spreadsheet since 2004] and migrated to jQuery.sheet in 2010. - Free and open source. * [[wikiCalc]] (now called SocialCalc) - Free, download application for online use. * [[ZCubes - Calci]] - Free. * [[Zoho Office Suite]] - Free for personal use. ===Spreadsheets that are parts of suites=== *[[Gnumeric]] - for [[Windows]] and [[Linux]]. Started as the [[Linux]] [[GNOME|Gnome]] desktop spreadsheet. Reasonably light-weight but has very advanced features.[http://www.gnome.org/projects/gnumeric/downloads.shtml GNOME Office / Gnumeric - Downloading Gnumeric] *[[KSpread]] - following the fork of the [[Calligra Suite]] from [[KOffice]] in mid-2010, superseded by [[KCells]] in [[KOffice]] and [[Calligra_Tables|Tables]] in the [[Calligra Suite]]. [http://www.koffice.org/ The KOffice Project] *[[LibreOffice]] Calc - developed for Windows, Linux, [[Berkeley_Software_Distribution|Bsd]] and [[Mac_OS_X|Mac]] operating systems by [[The Document Foundation]]. TDF was formed in mid-2010 by several large organisations such as [[Google]], [[Redhat|RedHat]], [[Canonical_Ltd|Canonical]] ([[Ubuntu_(operating_system)|Ubuntu]]) and [[Novell]] along with the OOo Community (developed by [[Sun Microsystems|Sun]]) and various OpenOffice.org forks, notably [[Go-oo]]. Go-oo had been the "OpenOffice" used in Ubuntu and elsewhere. LibreOffice started as [[StarOffice]] in the late 1990s, became OpenOffice under [[Sun Microsystems|Sun]] and then LibreOffice in mid-2010. TDF works with external organisations such as NeoOffice and [[Apache Foundation]] to help drive all 3 products forwards. [http://www.libreoffice.org/ LibreOffice] *[[NeoOffice]] - for [[Mac_OS_X|Mac]]. Started as an OpenOffice.org port to Macs but by using the Mac-specific [[Aqua (user interface)|Aqua]] [[user interface]] instead of the more widely used X11 windowing server it aimed to be far more stable than the normal ports of other suites.[http://www.neooffice.org NeoOffice Home] *[[OpenOffice.org]] [[OpenOffice.org Calc|Calc]] - for Windows, Linux and Mac. Started as [[StarOffice]]. [[Sun Microsystems|Sun]] changed the name to OpenOffice.org and developed a community of developers (and others) between the late 1990s and mid-2010. Oracle gave it to the Apache Foundation in 2011. IBM contributed their fork of OOo, [[IBM Lotus Symphony]], to Apache a few weeks later. [http://www.openoffice.org/ OpenOffice.org: Home] *[[Siag Office|Siag]] - for Linux, [[OpenBSD]] and Mac OS X. A a simple old spreadsheet, part of Siag Office.{{cite web |url=http://siag.nu/siag/ |title=Scheme In A Grid |date=2000-12-07 |accessdate=2010}} *[[Calligra_Tables|Tables]] - for Windows, Linux, [[FreeBSD]], Mac OS X and [[Haiku (operating system)|Haiku]]. Part of the extensive [[Calligra Suite]]. Possibly still mainly for Linux but ports have been developed for other [[Operating_System|Operating Systems]].[http://www.calligra-suite.org/ The Calligra Suite] ===Standalone spreadsheets=== *[[Bean Sheet]][http://bsheet.sourceforge.net Bean Sheet] *[[GNU Oleo]][http://www.gnu.org/software/oleo/oleo.html Oleo - GNU Project - Free Software Foundation (FSF)] ==Proprietary software== ===Online spreadsheets=== {{main|List of online spreadsheets}} *[[EditGrid]][http://www.editgrid.com/ Online Spreadsheets - EditGrid] – access, collaborate and share spreadsheets online, with API support *[[Google Spreadsheets]] – as part of [[Google Docs & Spreadsheets]] *[[iRows]][http://www.irows.com/ t p s i r at irows.com] – closed since 31 December 2006 *[[JotSpot]] Tracker[http://tracker.jot.com/ Share spreadsheet online!] – acquired by [[Google Inc.]] *[[Spreader]] - Free service that converts OpenOffice Excel spreadsheets into web .NET applications.[http://www.vertaron.com/spreader/ Spreader] *[[Smartsheet]][http://www.smartsheet.com/ Smartsheet Home] - Online spreadsheet for project management, interactive Gantt, file sharing, integrated with [[Google Apps]][https://www.google.com/enterprise/marketplace/viewListing?productListingId=3429+4388443950638085375&pli=1 Google Apps Marketplace Profile] *[[ThinkFree Office|ThinkFree Online]] Calc – as part of the ThinkFree Office online office suite, using [[Java (programming language)|Java]] ===Spreadsheets that are parts of suites=== *[[Ability Office]] Spreadsheet - for MS Windows.[http://www.ability.com/ Ability Plus Software - Home Page] *[[Apple iWork]] [[Numbers (software)|Numbers]], included with Apple's [[iWork]] '08 suite exclusively for Mac OS X v10.4 or higher. *[[AppleWorks]] - for MS Windows and Macintosh. This is a further development of the historical [[Claris Works]] Office suite.[http://www.apple.com/appleworks/ Apple - Support - AppleWorks] *[[WordPerfect Office]] [[Quattro Pro]] - for MS Windows. Was one of the big three spreadsheets (the others being Lotus 123 and Excel).[http://www.corel.com/ Untitled Document] *[[EasyOffice]] EasySpreadsheet - for MS Windows. No longer freeware, this suite aims to be more user friendly than competitors.http://www.e-press.com/home.asp *[[Framework (office suite)|Framework]] - for MS Windows. Historical office suite still available and supported. It includes a spreadsheet.[http://www.framework.com/ Framework home page & the FRED Computer Language, Framework IV, II, III, V, VI, VI, VII] *[[IBM Lotus Symphony]] - freeware for MS Windows, Mac OS X and GNU/Linux. *[[Lotus SmartSuite]] [[Lotus 123]] - for MS Windows. Widely considered to be responsible for the explosion of popularity of spreadsheets during the 80's and early 90's.[http://www-142.ibm.com/software/sw-lotus/products/product2.nsf/wdocs/sshome IBM office productivity suite - Lotus SmartSuite] *[[Mariner software|MarinerPak]] [[Mariner software|Mariner Calc]] - for Apple Macintosh. Full featured and light weight.[http://www.marinersoftware.com/sitepage.php?page=14 Macintosh Spreadsheet Software by Mariner Software] *[[Microsoft Office]] [[Microsoft Excel|Excel]] - for MS Windows and Macintosh. The proprietary spreadsheet leader.http://office.microsoft.com/excel/ *[[Microsoft Works]] Spreadsheet - for MS Windows (previously DOS and Machintosh). Only allows one sheet at a time.[http://www.microsoft.com/products/works/default.mspx Microsoft Works Home] *[[PlanMaker]] - for MS Windows, Linux, Windows Mobile, and Windows CE; part of [[SoftMaker Office]] *[[Quattro Pro]] - part of [[WordPerfect Office]] *[[StarOffice]] Calc - Cross-platform. StarOffice was originally developed by the German company Star Division which was purchased by [[Sun Microsystems|Sun]] in 1998. The code was made open source and became [[OpenOffice.org]]. Sun continues developing the commercial version which periodically integrates the open source code with their own and third party code to make new low price versions.[http://www.sun.com/software/star/staroffice/index.jsp StarOffice 8] *[[XOOM|Xoom Office]] Spreadsheet - for MS Windows.[http://web.archive.org/web/19970414171055/www.xoom.com/html/newxoom/programs.htm Xoom Software, Inc] ===Stand alone spreadsheets=== * [[As Easy As]] - from Trius, Inc. Windows version currently available as freeware * [[Mariner software|Mariner Calc]] for Macintosh. * Abykus (shareware for Windows)http://www.abykus.com/index.html ===Multi-Dimensional spreadsheets=== *[[numberGo Publisher]] [http://www.numbergo.com/ Free Business Intelligence Tool by numberGo - Pivot Tables, Charting, Reporting] *[[Quantrix Modeler]] [http://www.quantrix.com/ Quantrix | Business Modeling & Analytics Software | Financial Modeling | Data Modeling] *[[Lotus Improv]] *[[Javelin Software|Javelin]] ===Spreadsheets on different paradigms=== *[[Javelin Software|Javelin]] *[[Lotus Improv]] *[[Quantrix Modeler]] * [[Resolver One]][http://www.kyenslab.com/en/ KyensLab Inc.] - a business application development tool that represents spreadsheets as [[IronPython]] programs, created and executed in real time and allowing the spreadsheet flow to be fully programmed *[[Spreadsheet 2000]] ===Spreadsheet-related developmental software=== *[[ExtenXLS]] - Java Spreadsheet Toolkit. Spreadsheet automation and data mapping from any source, integration with Sheetster.com web spreadsheet, publish calculated cells as RSS feeds, and more.[http://www.extentech.com Java Excel :: Java Spreadsheets :: EAI :: SOA :: Open Source ::] ===Add-ins and spreadsheet assisting apps=== *[[numberGo Publisher]] - Data analysis tool that lets you quickly pivot and chart data, and save it as a portable document. Documents are able to be opened and viewed with a free reader.[http://www.numbergo.com Free Business Intelligence Tool by numberGo - Pivot Tables, Charting, Reporting] == Specifications == {{Expand list|date=August 2008}}

[[Image:OOoCalc.svg|25px]] || 1,048,576 || 1024 || 1,073,741,824 || 256 || 274,877,906,944 |- |'''[[Resolver One]]'''|| limited by machine memory* || limited by machine memory* || limited machine memory* || limited by machine memory* || limited by machine memory* |- |}
-* [[32-bit]] addressable memory, i.e. ~3.5GB. ==Historical== *[[3D-Calc]] multi-dimensional spreadsheet for [[Atari ST]][http://3d-calc.atari.org/ Frank's Atari ST pages] *[[Lotus 1-2-3]] *[[Lotus Improv]] *[[Lotus Symphony for DOS|Lotus Symphony]] *[[Multiplan]] *[[Perfect Calc]] - [[CP/M]]-80 and [[CP/M]]-86 Part of the Perfect Office suite, included with early Kaypro 8-bit computers *PlanPerfect. This was a companion to WordPerfect. *qubecalc the original 3d spreadsheet ms-dos *[[shared public spreadsheets]] - Works records system *[[SuperCalc]] - [[CP/M]]-80 Included with early Osborne computers *[[VisiCalc]] *Vu-Calc spreadsheet for Sinclair and Timex-Sinclair computers *[[Wingz]] Multi Dimensional Spreadsheet from Informix ( 1988 ) ==See also== *[[Comparison of spreadsheets]] *[[Logical spreadsheet]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Spreadsheets}} [[Category:Lists of software|Spreadsheets]] [[Category:Spreadsheet software|*]] [[id:Daftar perangkat lunak lembatang sebar]]
